description.narrative: Alternative & non-formal learning opportunities that provide functional literacy & numeracy are available to out-of-school children, especially adolescent mothers, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: School-aged girls and boys, especially early adolescents (aged 10-14) [in targeted districts], acquire essential learning outcomes and practice skills for life, are safe from exploitation, harmful practices and violence, and benefit from integrated social services (including in emergencies).

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Alternative & non-formal learning opportunities that provide functional literacy & numeracy are available to out-of-school children, especially adolescent mothers

description.narrative: Malawi's first national functional literacy curriculum was finalized in 2019. A total of 38, 997 (23,636 girls and 15,361 boys) vulnerable children and adolescents were equipped with basic literacy and numeracy skills. Three hundred vulnerable adolescent girls were equipped with vocational and entrepreneurial skills, graduated from the Functional Literacy Programme, and gained access to improved employment and economic income generating activities through links that were established between the Functional Literacy Programme and a vocational skills training programme. The Functional Literacy Programme was institutionalized through the establishment of a programme unit within the ministry and the development of the national curriculum. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of learners accesing alternative/flexible learning model through UNICEF support

Service Delivery - Number of children/adolescents studying lower secondary education through alternative modes of delivery (formal or non formal, e.g. evening school, weekend school, distance learning) with support from UNICEF
